updateLastLoginTime

public boolean updateLastLoginTime(int empID,
                                   java.sql.Timestamp time)
                            throws DBException,
                                   DBDownException
Updates the last login time of the given employee to the time contained within the given timestamp.

Parameters:
empID - The ID of the employee to update.
time - The time to update the employee to.
Returns:
True if the update was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
DBException - If there was an error with executing the update in the database.
DBDownException - If the communication with the database has failed and it is likely down.

tryLogin

public Employee tryLogin(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws InvalidLoginException,
                         DBException,
                         DBDownException,
                         PermissionViolationException
Validates the given username and password by attempting to retrieve a matching employee from the database. If found, the employee object will be returned, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
username - The username of the employee that is logging in.
password - The password of the employee that is logging in.
Returns:
The employee object for the employee that has logged in.
Throws:
InvalidLoginException - when the username or password does not match a record in the database.
PermissionViolationException
InvalidPermissionException
java.sql.SQLException - if there was an issue with the database connection or search query.
java.lang.NullPointerException
DBException
DBDownException

                       throws DBDownException,
                              DBChangeException,

Attempts to change the password of the currently logged in user.

Parameters:
oldPass - The old password, matching what is currently in the database.
newPass - The new password to change to.
caller - The user who is currently logged in.
Returns:
true if the password is changed, false otherwise.
Throws:
DBDownException
DBException
DBChangeException

parseResults

protected Employee[] parseResults(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from class: Broker
Parses a ResultSet returned by a select query back into cachable objects. The original search must have used a "SELECT *" so that full employee objects are in the ResultSet.

Specified by:
parseResults in class Broker<Employee>
Returns:
An array of cachable objects.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

parseResultsStatic

                                     throws java.sql.SQLException

Parameters:

Returns:

raceCheck

private boolean raceCheck(Employee oldEmp,
                          Employee caller)
                   throws DBException,
                          DBDownException,
                          InvalidPermissionException,
                          PermissionViolationException
Checks if an employee object is an exact match with an employee record in the database.

Parameters:
oldEmp - The employee object to compare to the database.
caller - The Employee who is currently logged into the system.
Returns:
true if the given employee object matches a database record, false otherwise.
Throws:
PermissionViolationException
InvalidPermissionException
DBDownException - if the database is own and the race check can not be done.
DBException - if an sql statement failed to execute in the database.
